p.s: In his speech Michel Barnier stated that the Brexit is a lose-lose situation for both.
I would agree partly with him because it's way worse for Britain than for Europe.
Britain suffers from several shortages like truck drivers and even some products, because of new travel restrictions for workers which are caused by the Brexit.
Moreover companies in the UK are challenged with new paperwork, which is also caused by the Brexit while I as a European haven't even noticed any change since Britain left the EU.
Of course some European companies may also suffer from the new paperwork.
But in general the life in the EU hasn't changed.
So in conclusion, I don't think that it's a reelreal lose-lose situation.
